newsitem.title: USA: JMC Group, USBA Holdings settle lawsuits.
newsitem.headline: JMC Group, USBA Holdings settle lawsuits.

text.p: JMC Group Inc and USBA Holdings Ltd have settled litigation associated with the companies' terminated merger, JMC said Monday.
In a statement, the companies said they wanted "to avoid the time and expenses of protracted litigation."

Originally, JMC filed suit in federal court in San Diego alleging various causes of action against USBA and certain individuals. USBA counterclaimed, seeking damages and specific performance from JMC and certain individuals.
As part of the settlement, neither party admitted liability, and a consulting agreement, marketing agreement and merger agreement were all terminated by mutual consent.
USBA refunded a portion of the consulting fees paid to it, and a warrant to purchase one million shares of JMC was canceled.
USBA and JMC also reallocated costs incurred in the failed merger.
